name: #7: "The Future Needs More You" by Natalie de Weerd and "Charge or Cheat? The Ethics of Billing for AI-Generated Work" by Dr Kardi Somerfield
description: Explore the human edge in AI development and the ethics of AI-assisted client work. Two thought-provoking talks on staying relevant and ethical in an AI-driven future. These subjects are sure to spark great conversations.
location: Vulcan Works, 34-38 Guildhall Rd, Northampton, NN1 1EW
parking: St. John's Multi Storey Car Park

schedule.title: "The Future Needs More You" by Natalie de Weerd
schedule.description: In a world racing toward AI dominance, there’s one thing the machines can't replicate: the boundless spark of human creativity. Join me for a deep dive into why "intelligent" AI still can't outthink human imagination - and how developers and innovators have always thrived by embracing the unknown. We'll expose real-world AI slip-ups, revisit times we thought technology might replace us (spoiler alert - it didn't), and reveal how your personal spark remains the ultimate edge in any AI-driven future.

schedule.title: "Charge or Cheat? The Ethics of Billing for AI-Generated Work" by Dr Kardi Somerfield
schedule.description: AI can do in minutes what once took hours—but should clients be charged the same? This provocative session tackles the commercial dilemma developers face when using AI in client work. We'll explore industry expectations, and unpack emerging norms around transparency, value-based pricing, human oversight and client consent in AI-augmented work.
